content.text: Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, there lived a king who had eleven sons and one daughter, named Elisa. Their mother had passed away when Elisa was very young, and the king soon remarried.
But the new queen was a wicked woman who did not love the children. From the very first day, she treated them unkindly, especially the poor little Elisa.
One day, the queen decided to get rid of the children once and for all. She took the eleven princes and turned them into wild swans with her dark magic.
The swans flew out of the palace windows and disappeared into the sky. Then, she tried to bewitch Elisa, but the little girl was too pure of heart, and the queen’s magic could not harm her.
Still, the queen sent Elisa away to live with peasants in the countryside, hoping she would forget her royal life. Years passed, and Elisa grew into a kind and beautiful young woman.
Though she lived simply, she never forgot her brothers. One day, she found eleven white feathers in the field and knew in her heart they belonged to her brothers.
She decided to search for them, no matter how far she had to go. Elisa traveled through dark forests and over high mountains until she reached the sea.
There, she saw eleven magnificent swans with golden crowns on their heads. As the sun set, the swans landed on the shore and transformed into her eleven brothers!
They were overjoyed to see her, but their happiness was short-lived. They explained that they could only take their human form for a quarter of an hour each evening.
The rest of the time, they were bound to be swans. “How can we break the spell?” Elisa asked, her eyes filled with tears.
Her eldest brother told her, “You must gather nettles from the churchyard and weave them into eleven shirts. But you must not speak a single word until the task is done, or the magic will never be
broken.” Elisa knew this would be difficult, but she was determined to save her brothers. She set to work at once, gathering the stinging nettles with her bare hands.
The nettles burned her skin, but she did not complain. She spun the fibers into thread and began weaving the shirts, one by one.
One day, a young king was hunting in the forest when he came across Elisa. He was struck by her beauty and kindness, and though she could not speak, he fell deeply in love with her.
He took her back to his castle and made her his queen. But the king’s mother was a wicked woman, just like Elisa’s stepmother. She did not trust the silent queen and spread lies about her.
“She must be a witch,” the old queen whispered to the court. “Why else would she weave shirts from nettles in the dead of night?” The people began to fear Elisa, and soon, she was accused of sorcery.
Even the king could not protect her when the archbishop declared she must be burned at the stake. On the day of her execution, Elisa worked feverishly to finish the last shirt.
The flames were already lit when the eleven swans flew down from the sky. Elisa threw the shirts over them, and at once, the swans transformed back into her brothers! The spell was broken!
Elisa could finally speak, and she told the king and the people the whole story. The wicked stepmother and the king’s mother were punished for their cruelty, and Elisa and her brothers were reunited
at last. The king and Elisa lived happily ever after, and her brothers became noble princes once more. And so, with love and courage, Elisa had saved her brothers from the dark magic that bound
them, proving that even the hardest trials can be overcome with a pure heart.
